content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
I need to scan three GitHub repositories to find new tools, skills, and architectures. Let me break this down:

1. First, I'll scan each repository to understand their structure and find interesting ideas
2. Pick the best idea to implement as a PopeBot skill
3. Write the code for the skill
4. Test it
5. Email a progress report

Let me start by exploring these repositories. I'll use bash to clone them and examine their contents.

content.text: I'll scan these three repositories to discover new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement the best idea as a PopeBot skill. Let me start by exploring each repository.
